name: What Makes It Great® with Rob Kapilow and Gryphon Trio

location.name: Jane Mallett Theatre, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

description:
With infectious curiosity and a gift for revealing the deeper meaning within great works, Rob Kapilow has captivated audiences for decades. 

Enjoy his rendition of Dvořák's Piano Quintet in A major, Op. 81, one of the most beloved works in the chamber music repertoire. He is joined by The Gryphon Trio to bring this rich, folk-infused masterpiece to life as Rob unpacks its melodies, structure, and emotional depth.

Whether you're hearing this piece for the first time or the hundredth, you'll come away with a newfound appreciation.

name: Love Bugs: How Insects Survive Winter in High Park
description:
Ever wonder how a bee spends the winter, or where a beetle hides when the frost settles in?

 Join us for a cheerful outdoor nature walk through High Park as we explore how insects and other "love bugs" stay safe and snug in Toronto's cold Canadian winter. 

This family-friendly program is designed for all ages, we'll keep a comfortable pace, make plenty of stops to learn and look closely, and discover the science behind these tiny winter survivors. 

Bundle up and bring your curiosity.
